subject: Re: [junit] ClassCastException with JAXB object
msgSnippet: I wonder if there s any chance that those classes are being reloaded by the JUnit classloader... Have a look here on how to fix that:
messageBody:
I wonder if there's any chance that those classes are being reloaded by the JUnit classloader...

Have a look here on how to fix that: http://junit.sourceforge.net/doc/faq/faq.htm#running_9

You will find the excluded.properties in the JUnit jar and patch it.

FWIW, if you use 7-zip, http://7-zip.org/, you can open the file, find excluded.properties and edit it in place rather than having to extract the jar, edit the file and re-create the jar using either winzip or jar.

I'm not affiliated with 7-zip, I just use it.

Tutorials and Articles
http://schuchert.wikispaces.com/



----- Original Message ----
From: urban0_0legend <njones5319@...>
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Thursday, June 29, 2006 8:30:09 AM
Subject: [junit] ClassCastException with JAXB object


When running JUnit, this code:

JAXBContext context = JAXBContext. newInstance
("com.td.ds. coreAccount. utility.xml" );
Unmarshaller unMarshaller = context.createUnmar shaller() ;
BusinessTypes busTypes = (BusinessTypes) unMarshaller. unmarshal
(input);

will generate a ClassCastException, but only when running through JUnit
test cases. Any ideas why this would be hapenning? I am running JUnit
3.8.1 using Parasoft JTest 6.0.

Thanks very much!




[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
